image.altText: A close-up of the side of an ambulance

props.synopsis: A patient at a residential aged care home in suburban Adelaide died while waiting around five hours for an ambulance, the state's ambulance union says, with the case now a matter for the coroner.

title.children: Aged care patient dies while waiting five hours for ambulance, union says

image.altText: A person holds a really small fish.

props.synopsis: The Dalhousie goby, catfish and hardyhead, all located in a freshwater spring in outback South Australia, join a threatened species list growing larger by the year.

title.children: Three fish from same outback spring among 13 species added to Australia's threatened list

image.altText: Jessica Hull silver

props.synopsis: Jess Hull put in the run of her life to claim silver in the 1,500m, after the Stingers earlier finished runner-up in the women's water polo, and a score of Aussies finished fourth in their events.

title.children: Jess Hull claims Olympic silver in stunning 1,500m run, as Stingers finish runner-up in the water polo

image.altText: GettyImages-2166039926

props.synopsis: Australia's chef de mission says criticism of breaker Raygun has been disappointing, as her Paris Olympics performance continues to go viral.

title.children: 'I absolutely love her courage': Meares defends Raygun after wave of online ridicule for Paris performance

image.altText: DSC06537 copy

props.synopsis: For most of his life, rock star Nick Cave says he was "in awe of his own genius". Cataclysmic life events fundamentally "re-arranged" him.

title.children: The moment that ended Nick Cave's 'disgraceful self-indulgence'

image.altText: A man standing behind a building.

props.synopsis: Manufacturing once played a critical role in the Australian economy but now makes up less than 6 per cent of the nation's GDP. So why is the government trying to revive it now?

title.children: Almost two decades ago, Peter was made redundant at Holden. Now the government wants a future made in Australia

image.altText: Two boys lug sacks of rice on their shoulders.

props.synopsis: For more than two months, the only way to get food, medicine and other supplies into Porgera has been to carry them by foot over a huge cascade of rocks left by a landslide.

title.children: In the town cut off by a massive landslide in PNG, locals walk over buried loved ones to transit essential goods

image.altText: Australia players stand and smile

props.synopsis: How you respond to missing out is just as important as how you respond to success. On that measure alone, these Aussie Stingers are true champions.

title.children: Stingers meet success and failure with the same, indomitable spirit

image.altText: An old photo of Marilyn taking a photo of her daughter, who is next to her husband, outside a church.

props.synopsis: Audra Keeble remembers the "touchy feely" photographer's assistant at her wedding who kept adjusting her veil and dress. It was a piece of a puzzle she wouldn't solve until years later, as she uncovered the truth about her life.

title.children: Secrets, lies and false documents could not stop this mother and daughter reuniting

image.altText: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: A well-funded lobby group has been spending millions on US election races to punish Democrats who don't toe the line on Israel.

title.children: The pro-Israel lobby came for 'the Squad' — and sent a message to Kamala Harris

image.altText: A sillouette of a destroyed building with children in the foreground

props.synopsis: More than 80 Palestinians are dead and dozens injured after an Israeli air strike on a school sheltering displaced people east of Gaza City, according to Palestinian authorities.

title.children: White House 'deeply concerned' over Israeli airstrike that hit Gaza school, killing more than 80 Palestinians

image.altText: Two men in suits stand in front of the Australian flag, with one speaking and the other looking at him

props.synopsis: ASIO told the newly elected Albanese government in mid-2022 to lower Australia's national terror alert level to "possible", but Labor stalled on the advice for almost half a year before enacting it.

title.children: Labor stalled for months on lowering terror alert level after ASIO recommendation in 2022

image.altText: Pictures and frames sit on a side table in an aged care room.

props.synopsis: Intense pressure is mounting on the federal government to deliver on promised changes to aged care, as advocates and providers fear the reforms won't be introduced before the next federal election.

title.children: 'Incredibly urgent': Pressure builds for government to deliver promised aged care reforms

image.altText: A composite image of four Liberal party politicians.

props.synopsis: David Speirs has announced his resignation as South Australia's opposition leader, with the state's Liberal Party expected to decide on his successor on Monday.

title.children: South Australia's opposition leader has quit. Here's who could replace him

image.altText: Crowds watching a lit up stage

props.synopsis: South Australia's Harvest Rock is the latest music festival to find itself in limbo, with organisers cancelling the upcoming instalment which had been scheduled for October.

title.children: Another music festival in dire straits, as upcoming Harvest Rock cancelled

image.altText: Rob 1

props.synopsis: Two churches in Adelaide's north are about to launch a pilot program to provide temporary crisis accommodation for the homeless. The move required a change to planning guidelines — but already there are hopes the idea could provide much needed relief for many doing it toughest.

title.children: Churches are places of worship — but some are now offering places to stay to those doing it toughest

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: It's time to flex your trivia muscle. Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Think you've got what it takes to win Hard Quiz? Let’s play … HARD!

image.altText: Eliud Kipchoge runs in the pack

props.synopsis: Arguably the greatest marathon runner in history, Eliud Kipchoge, could not claim a third straight Olympic title, pulling out of the race won by Ethiopia's Tamirat Tola.

title.children: Father Time catches up with marathon's greatest runner as Eliud Kipchoge pulls out of marathon

image.altText: A young couple embrace happily inside their new home, surrounded by moving boxes.

props.synopsis: Even though you may not have introduced your new partner to all your friends and family — if you live together, the ATO wants you to declare it on your tax return.

title.children: Do you live with your partner? Here's why you need to declare their earnings in your tax return

image.altText: A close-up shot of an older man with a long white beard.

props.synopsis: He's famous for roles in some of Australia's finest movies, from Breaker Morant to Wake in Fright. But it was the year he spent in the territory outback as a teenager that Jack Thompson says had an impact that has "lasted me my life".

title.children: 'Like I was their son': Jack Thompson reflects on his youth working alongside outback stockmen

image.altText: Rohingya refugee women queue for food aid

props.synopsis: The reported attack, estimated to have killed about 150 people, would be one of the deadliest incidents involving civilians in the country's ongoing civil war.

title.children: Ethnic armed group in Myanmar suspected of deadly attack on Rohingya Muslims

image.altText: A pink powder in the hand of a scientist

props.synopsis: Researchers hope to turn milk protein lactoferrin into a nasal spray, but there are many hurdles to overcome before you'll see it on pharmaceutical shelves.

title.children: Been told to avoid dairy when you're sick? Scientists are proving that could be an old wives' tale

image.altText: Composite image of Kaylee McKeown and sailor Matt Wearn with their gold medals at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Swimmer Kaylee McKeown and sailor Matt Wearn both made history at the Paris Olympics. Now, they've been named as Australia's flag-bearers at the closing ceremony.

title.children: Kaylee McKeown and Matt Wearn return to Paris to carry Australian flag in closing ceremony

image.altText: Lauren Jackson holds a basketball above her head

props.synopsis: Here's everything that's going to be happening on day 16 of the Olympic Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule day 16: Opals hit the court in the last day of competition before the Closing Ceremony

image.altText: Penny Wong wears a maroon blazer as she speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has rebuked a senior Israeli minister who suggested it "might be just and moral" to starve Palestinians in Gaza until hostages held by Hamas are returned.

title.children: Penny Wong condemns Israeli minister’s comments that Gazan starvation may be justified

image.altText: Freshwater crocodile floats atop a clear lake during the middle of the day

props.synopsis: The freshwater crocodile found in an artificial lake near the outback Queensland town leaves residents scratching their heads after evading wildlife officers and surviving freezing temperatures.

title.children: Croc nicknamed Houdini of Hughenden gives wildlife officers the slip

image.altText: Flames surround the firing of a missile from a military ship

props.synopsis: In a move the federal government said added to the Royal Australian Navy's "long-range strike capability", HMAS Sydney has fired a Standard Missile 6 in a military exercise near Hawaii.

title.children: Royal Australian Navy fires long-range missile in military exercise off Hawaii

image.altText: Susan Wojcicki

props.synopsis: Susan Wojcicki was at the helm at YouTube for nine years, before which she held various positions at Google including being its first marketing manager and helping with the platform's creation.

title.children: Susan Wojcicki, influential tech figure who led growth of Google and YouTube, dies aged 56

image.altText: A split image shows Andrew Forrest smiling and Gina Rinehart in red hat

props.synopsis: Gina Rinehart and Andrew Forrest are billionaires who made their fortunes in mining. Now, the long-time rivals are going toe-to-toe in apparel, buying up some of Australia's most iconic brands. But this foray into fashion is about more than boots.

title.children: 'It's a way of buying influence': The billionaires acquiring Australia's most iconic brands

image.altText: Mac Andrew is mobbed by teammates after his goal

props.synopsis: Mac Andrew has kicked a goal after the siren to deal a hammer blow to Essendon's finals hopes, as the Suns recorded their first road win of the season.

title.children: 'Something every kid dreams of': Suns star dashes Bombers' finals hopes with goal after the siren

image.altText: Kyle Flanagan of the Dragons runs with the ball in two hands

props.synopsis: Canterbury captain Stephen Crichton has accused St George five-eighth Kyle Flanagan of biting him during the Bulldogs' win over the Dragons.

title.children: Flanagan accused of biting rival as Sele taken to hospital with irregular heartbeat

image.altText: A building on fire

props.synopsis: Fighting in the Kursk region of Russia continues and video shared by Ukranian media show troops in control of a Russian town.

title.children: Russia reinforces Kursk region as video shows evidence of Ukrainian 'invasion'

image.altText: Sheikh Hasina behind a bouquet.

props.synopsis: Long-time Bangladeshi leader Sheikh Hasina is ready to face trial back home after fleeing to New Delhi on Monday, her son Sajeeb Wazed says.

title.children: 'The threat of arrest has never scared my mother': Hasina's son says former Bangladesh PM to return for trial

image.altText: GettyImages-2166052398

props.synopsis: Have you seen breaking all over your feed and want to tune in for more? Strap-in, class is in session. We're about to break down the mystery and majesty that is gold medal breaking.

title.children: Here's everything you need to know about your new favourite Olympic sport, breaking
